critique: This document is an executive order regarding the transfer of functions from the Foreign Operations Administration to the Department of State and the Department of Defense. It primarily deals with the administration of foreign aid and mutual security programs. There is no direct indication of ideological tilt, immigration approach, or social inclusion. It shifts some power to the Department of Defense, but it's mainly an administrative reorganization. It's difficult to assess its impact on national security vs. civil liberties or economic regulation based solely on this document. Therefore, most scores will be neutral, with a slight lean towards federal primacy due to the reorganization at the federal level.
